task.title: Disabling Automatic SSL Certificate Generation
task.shortdesc: When the user console service is run for the first time, it will generate a self-signed certificate and key which will be put into /etc/eucalyptus-console/. If you do not want to have a certificate and key generated and would like to use your own, you can disable automatic generation of the certificate and key.

context.p: To disable automatic generation of the console certificate and key:

note.p: If you choose not to use the default SSL certificate and key, you must provide your own. For more information on generating self-signed SSL certificates, go to http://www.akadia.com/services/ssh_test_certificate.html.
For information on configuring SSL certificate and key paths for your own certificate and key, see Configuring SSL Certificate Paths.
